intro: Melanoseris rapunculoides, commonly known as the white cypress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided segments, and it produces small white to pale yellow flowers in summer. Melanoseris rapunculoides is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
